articles.title: The AI paradox: How tomorrow's cutting-edge tools can become dangerous cyber threats (and what to do to prepare)
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Next-generation AI applications like agentic AI pose a significant risk to organizations' security posture. Gartner predicts that one-third of all generative AI interactions will use these agents by 2028. Cybersecurity strategies need to adapt before businesses implement these AI applications.

articles.title: ChatGPT's Advanced AI Now Free for Windows Users
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Microsoft's AI chief, Mustafa Suleyman, announced that Copilot users can access o1 for free. Think Deeper harnesses the capabilities of OpenAI's state-of-the-art o1 model. It was previously only available through expensive subscription tiers. It remains to be seen if Microsoft will monetize the service.

articles.title: 3 Top Artificial Intelligence Stocks to Buy Right Now
articles.author: Keithen Drury
articles.summary: After the AI sell-off, some stocks remain on sale, including DeepSeek, Meta Platforms, and Google Cloud. AI is still a huge investment area for Alphabet, but it's just a side business of the company's main advertising business. The company has integrated AI tools into its various Google ad tools.

articles.title: AI in healthcare will benefit all
articles.summary: Malaysia's healthcare system is undergoing a digital revolution with the adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) that promises to enhance efficiency, reduce costs and improve patient care. The system is currently in place in 56 clinics across Malaysia, with plans to triple this number by this year. There are challenges with integrating AI with outdated hospital IT systems and safeguarding data privacy.

articles.title: Vatican Releases 'Antiqua Et Nova' Essay On AI
articles.author: John Werner
articles.summary: The Vatican has released a paper on the potential and risks of artificial intelligence in a new high-tech world. The paper is signed by Cardinal Víctor Fernández, prefect of the Dicastery for the Doctrine of the Faith, and Cardinal José Tolentino de Mendonça. It's a look at these new technologies through the lens of religion with a focus on human worth and dignity.

articles.title: The Resilience Of Hands-On And Experience-Based Jobs In The Age Of AI
articles.author: Chris Westfall
articles.summary: As AI and automation continue to reshape industries, some professions remain difficult to replace with machines or artificial intelligence. For those looking for job security, look for hands-on and experience-based opportunities. The human touch remains central to customer satisfaction in service roles. The opportunity lies in workers enhancing their skills with technology rather than resisting it.

articles.title: 3 Best AI Stocks to Buy in February
articles.author: George Budwell
articles.summary: Palo Alto Networks uses AI to protect critical infrastructure for over 80,000 enterprise customers worldwide. Upstart transforms traditional lending by deploying AI across the loan approval process. Nvidia dominates the AI chip market through its graphics processing units and specialized accelerators. The company's semiconductors power AI workloads across every major cloud provider.

articles.title: Future-Proofing Your Career: Upskilling in AI and ML for Millennials and Gen Z
articles.author: Ethan Stone
articles.summary: According to PwC's 2024 Global AI Jobs Barometer, the number of job postings requiring AI specialist skills has increased sevenfold from 2012 to 2023. The rise of automation means some jobs may disappear, but others will evolve or be created entirely. For job seekers and professionals alike, building AI and ML skills is becoming a necessity.

articles.title: Posted Feb 2, 2025 at 3:40 PM EST
articles.author: Richard Lawler
articles.summary: OpenAI teases 'Deep Research' stream at 7PM ET. A post on X says a livestream is scheduled for 4PM PT / 9AM JST. OpenAI has recently announced Sora, scheduled tasks in ChatGPT and its computer-using Operator agent.

articles.title: How Leaders Can Leverage AI For Data Management And Decision-Making
articles.author: Brent Gleeson
articles.summary: In today's digital economy, data is the lifeblood of every high-performing organization. Up to 90% of IT budgets are spent on managing internal data complexities, leaving little room for innovation. AI-powered analytics can detect patterns, predict failures, and automate troubleshooting, reducing downtime and improving reliability. Only 39% of tech leaders currently leverage AI and machine learning for cloud infrastructure management.

articles.title: The Irish Times view on artificial intelligence: the fever dream breaks
articles.author: The Irish Times
articles.summary: Last week, a Chinese start-up, DeepSeek, showed powerful AIs could be developed. It was a significant breakthrough for the AI fever dream of the past two years. It took only a day for the fever dream to break and it came from a direction few would have guessed.

articles.title: Why Sam Altman's AGI Reflections Could Lead To Peril Or Progress
articles.author: India Currents
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is reshaping industries across the board. It's reshaping how we think about healthcare, research, and the future of medicine. Generative AI is replacing human creativity with machines. AI-generated deepfakes can fabricate events that never happened, and AI-written articles can flood social media with misinformation.

articles.author: Fahad Saleem
articles.summary: Palo Alto Networks, Inc. (NASDAQ:PANW) ranks 9th on our list of AI stocks on Wall Street's radar after DeepSeek breakthrough. articles.summary: ASML Holding N.V. (NASDAQ:ASML) reported Q4 earnings with a GAAP EPS of €6.85, exceeding estimates by €0.12, and revenue of €9.26 billion, up 27.9% year-over-year and surpassing expectations by €200 million. For 2025, ASML projects total net sales between €30 billion and €35 billion, with a gross margin of 51-53%.

articles.title: Russian Cancer Vaccine Could Be Available by Year's End
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Russia's government is working on a revolutionary personalized cancer vaccine. It will be available to the public by the end of this year. It uses AI to create custom-made vaccines tailored to each patient's cancer profile. Early clinical trials have shown a significant reduction in tumor size and an advancement in overall well-being.

articles.title: How some University of Alabama faculty are embracing AI in teaching
articles.author: Jessica Nelson
articles.summary: Lawrence Cappello and Katherine Chiou co-founded the AI Teaching Enhancement Initiative (AITEI) at the University of Alabama in 2023. They teach hands-on in the computer lab, walk faculty through the different programs and how to use prompts. They also spend a lot of time contextualizing AI and its impact on teaching and learning.

articles.title: New forms of AI present fresh challenges to educators
articles.author: Oman Observer
articles.summary: The Artificial Intelligence (AI) community has been in a hyperactive mode in the last few weeks with the introduction of DeepSeek, the Chinese AI platform that is said to be far more advanced than the previous one, DeepMind, which was released last year.

articles.title: When Doctors With A.I. Are Outperformed by A.I. Alone
articles.author: Pranav Rajpurkar
articles.summary: A.I. systems working independently performed better than when combined with physician input. This pattern emerged consistently across different medical tasks, from chest X-ray and mammography interpretation to clinical decision-making. The future of medicine is about finding the right balance between human expertise and artificial intelligence in ways that enhance and transform medical practice.

articles.title: Kazakhstan Railways Advances AI Testing With Digital Polygons
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: Kazakhstan Railways is creating digital polygons to test, approve and implement best practices for railways based on artificial intelligence, Azernews reports that.   Â. Â   yeref is a news agency of Mafna.

articles.title: UK to become first country to criminalise AI child abuse tools
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: UK will make it a crime to possess, create or distribute artificial intelligence tools that generate sexual content targeting children. It will also be a crime punishable by up to three years in prison to possess AI 'paedophile manuals' that teach people how to use AI to sexually abuse children.

articles.title: 10 Personal AI Assistants that Have Transformed Daily Lives
articles.summary: ChatGPT Streamlines Business Tasks, Google Assistant Simplifies Scheduling, Alexa Boosts Productivity, Siri Manages Tasks Efficiently, GrammarlyGO Improves Writing Efficiency, Motion Prevents Burnout, and custom GPTs Automate Repetitive Tasks.

articles.title: Mind on Money: AI's unprecedented opportunity
articles.author: Marc Ruiz Times Columnist
articles.summary: Markets were shaken last week when a Chinese startup, called DeepSeek, developed a functional Artificial Intelligence (AI) product to rival currently available, leading American AI models at a claimed small fraction of the cost. The AI market sector in the United States is priced for perfection and any narrative throwing doubt on the AI narrative has the capacity to disrupt markets.

articles.title: EU AI Act: First Requirements Become Legally Binding
articles.author: Fiona Jackson
articles.summary: As of February 2, 2025, the first few requirements of the E.U.'s AI Act are legally binding. Businesses operating in the region that do not abide by these requirements are at risk of a fine of up to 7% of their global annual turnover. Kirsten Rulf, co-author of the AI Act, said the Act is not stifling innovation but allows it to scale.

articles.title: Oman to Unveil Revised National AI Policy in Early 2025, Boosting Digital Economy Goals
articles.author: Khaleej Mag
articles.summary: Oman is set to release an updated national Artificial Intelligence (AI) policy in the first quarter of 2025. The policy will establish a comprehensive governance and create opportunities for economic growth and job creation in the digital space, according to the Oman Daily Observer report.

articles.title: 🤔Inside the OpenAI-DeepSeek Distillation Saga & Alibaba's Most Powerful AI Model Qwen2.5-Max
articles.author: Tony Peng
articles.summary: This week, DeepSeek came under scrutiny for potentially using generated outputs from OpenAI's platforms to train its models. This practice, known as Knowledge Distillation, transfers advanced capabilities from leading large language models (LLMs) to relatively less powerful ones. On January 29 (Beijing Time), the first day of the Chinese New Year, Alibaba unveiled its latest foundation model, Qwen2.5-Max. Microsoft security researchers discovered individuals suspected of extracting large amounts of data using the API in the fall.

articles.title: Are you chatting with a robot? ‘The Dead Internet Theory' explained
articles.author: Mike Costanza
articles.summary: The Dead Internet Theory suggests that most of the internet is dominated by AI-generated content and human-to-human interaction is becoming rare. Experts think that while bots are a growing problem, humans still dominate for the time being. The main reason people fill social media sites with bots is for money and influence.

articles.title: AI Goal to Kill Human Race
articles.author: Greg
articles.summary: Karen Kingston is a biotech analyst and former Pfizer employee. She is concerned about the recent mid-air collision that happened in Washington D.C. and the recent news of the mRNA AI cancer vaccine. She believes that AI is a global effort to replace how God created us with technology.

articles.title: Forget Billion-Dollar Companies—Will AI Create Billion-Dollar People?
articles.author: Nirit Cohen
articles.summary: AI is replacing humans at work, but it's not just about replacing people, it's also about empowering people to build their own AI-driven economic engines independent of traditional corporate structures. Aneesh Raman, LinkedIn's Chief Economic Opportunity Officer, explains how AI is changing the nature of work.

articles.title: Robots master Jenga whipping, motherboard assembly with AI learning
articles.author: Christopher Mcfadden
articles.summary: Researchers from University of California, Berkeley developed a new robot learning technique. It helps robots learn the basics of a task and then get better at it by practicing in the real world. The new AI learning method has been shown to dramatically improve the speed of learning and the precision of a robot completing a task.

articles.title: Super Bowl Ads Predicted the Dot Com and Crypto Bubbles. This Year's Will Be Filled With Ads for AI Companies
articles.summary: This year's Super Bowl is expected to feature a lot of ads for artificial intelligence. In 2000, the Super Bowl XXXIV featured 14 ads from web-based companies that spent an average of $2.2 million per 30-second spot. Many of them went under within a few years of being founded.

articles.title: Monroe High School's Response to the Use of Artificial Intelligence in the Classroom
articles.author: Josh Wilson
articles.summary: Monroe High School principal, Jeriamy Jackson, met with staff members to discuss the proliferation of artificial intelligence (AI) programs such as OpenAI's ChatGPT and the applicability of such platforms to high school coursework and classrooms. It should be noted that AI is not a new concept in education. For several years, students have used AI-type programs for help with solving math equations, checking for grammatical errors in writing assignments and translating languages.

articles.title: Six Takeaways From a Monumental Week for AI
articles.author: Ben Fritz
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has been a fast-moving, high-drama industry since OpenAI launched the viral chatbot ChatGPT a little more than two years ago. DeepSeek gave its models away, as open-source code, which helped make them popular among consumers, businesses and developers.

articles.title: The Future of AI Search How Dropbox Dash and Unily Are Leading the Way
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Dropbox Dash and Unily are AI-powered search engines. They integrate work related tools together in one place to help users retrieve files, emails, and other information in a timely manner. Unily is useful for large organizations with vast knowledge repositories. Dropbox Dash is relevant to freelancers, small businesses, and specialists using multiple cloud providers.

articles.title: How To Use ChatGPT To Overcome Barriers That Inhibit Curiosity At Work
articles.author: Dr. Diane Hamilton
articles.summary: Fear, Assumptions, Technology, and Environment inhibit people from exploring new possibilities in work and life. AI tools like ChatGPT can help people overcome internal and external barriers that keep people from asking questions, exploring new ideas, or taking risks. AI provides a safe space to explore ideas without judgment.

articles.title: The Robot Doctor Will See You Now
articles.summary: A growing body of research suggests that A.I. is outperforming doctors even when they use it as a tool. The solution is a deliberate division of labor. Medical training will need to adapt to help doctors understand when to rely on it and when to trust their own judgment.

articles.title: The Robot Doctor Will See You Now
articles.author: Pranav Rajpurkar
articles.summary: A growing body of research suggests that A.I. is outperforming doctors, even when they use it as a tool. Dr. Rajpurkar and his colleagues suggest a division of labor between doctors and artificial intelligence to improve the quality of care for the sick.

articles.title: Can God speak to us through AI? These faith leaders are finding out
articles.author: Eli Tan
articles.summary: Rabbi Josh Fixler used an AI chatbot called Rabbi Bot to write a sermon at Congregation Emanu El in Houston. Pastor Jay Cooper used ChatGPT to generate an entire service for his church as an experiment in 2023. Some religious leaders are sceptical about the ethical implications of using AI for religious tasks.

articles.title: AI systems with ‘unacceptable risk' are now banned in the EU
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: February 2 is the first compliance deadline for the EU's AI Act. The Act is designed to cover a myriad of use cases where AI might appear and interact with individuals, from consumer applications through to physical environments. There are four risk levels: minimal risk, limited risk, high risk, and unacceptable risk applications.

articles.title: Hiltzik: OpenAI accuses China of stealing its content, the same accusation that authors have made against OpenAI
articles.author: Los Angeles Times
articles.summary: Chinese firm DeepSeek unveiled an AI bot that is cheaper, more efficient and more accurate than American-made versions. OpenAI is accusing Deepseek of stealing its work to train R1. It's similar to the accusations that authors and artists have laid against OpenAI and other bot developers for using their works to 'train' their bots.

articles.summary: Phil the Groundhog is less than 40% accurate, according to the experts.    -   for accuracy of Phil's predictions.  - i.e. he's less than 30% accurate. - I believe he's 40% inaccurate.

articles.author: Amanda Smith
articles.summary: ChatGPT was released in 2022 and has undergone major updates, notably to the free version. There's a premium subscription for $20 per month, but free version is usually all you need. It's a handy tool to help assign age-appropriate housework tasks and organize a weekly chore chart for a family of four.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence is bringing nuclear power back from the dead — maybe even in California
articles.author: Alex Shultz
articles.summary: California is considering bringing back nuclear power as a source of innovation and economic growth. Some lawmakers are pushing for exemptions to the state's 49-year-old moratorium on the construction of new nuclear power plants. Big Tech companies have begun national efforts to rejuvenate the carbon-neutral energy source.

articles.title: DeepSeek provides competition to AI landscape, not existential threat, experts say
articles.author: Larry Rulison
articles.summary: On Monday, shares of AI chipmaker Nvidia dropped 17 percent, as the company stock lost nearly $600 million in value. The panic came a week after DeepSeek released its latest version of its AI app, which is available for download in the U.S. The company released data that seems to show that the app was developed on a shoestring budget of just $6 million, compared to billions of dollars being spent by OpenAI and others.

articles.title: Google's Gmail Upgrade—Do Not Leave Your Account At Risk
articles.author: Zak Doffman
articles.summary: Gmail has added default AI settings to Workspace apps. Many users are unhappy with the lack of easy-to-turn off controls. AI data leakage through AI engines is now headline news. Harmonic Security says more than 80% of people worry about data leaking via GenAI.

articles.title: Police Use of Facial Recognition Backfires Spectacularly When It Renders Them Unable to Convict Alleged Murderer
articles.author: Joe Wilkins
articles.summary: Police in Cleveland, Ohio just botched an important murder case by relying on evidence given to them by AI. Detectives were stumped while investigating the February 2024 murder of 33-year-old Blake Story. They sent security footage of a suspect to the Northeast Ohio Regional Fusion Center to plug into its AI program. The Fusion Center has been employing bold new AI products to help its staff cut down on their workload. One of those products was Clearview, the controversial New York-based facial-recognition platform that's facing a class-action federal lawsuit. A judge suppressed the AI evidence and all evidence predicated on the faulty warrant.

articles.title: Illinois Supreme Court Announces Policy on Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: Joanna Brown
articles.summary: The policy is consistent with the American Bar Association's AI Policy. The policy states that the courts will be vigilant against AI technologies that jeopardize due process, equal protection, or access to justice. Unsubstantiated or deliberately misleading AI generated content that perpetuates bias, prejudices litigants or obscures truth-finding and decision-making will not be tolerated.

articles.title: 'AI Will Make Sure You BEHAVE!': Oracle CEO: 'Citizens will be on their best behavior be
articles.author: Robert Lee

Cramer was wrong about the AI PC cycle as the PC he thought people were going to upgrade didn't materialize.

articles.summary: The UK is set to become the first country in the world to make it illegal to own or use artificial intelligence tools that create child sexual abuse images. New measures will see people jailed for up to five years for exploiting AI to create this content with even tougher 10-year sentences for people who run websites to share these images. Online Safety Act aims to protect children and adults.

articles.summary: Generative AI is changing the way we interact with machines. Tools like ChatGPT, Gemini, and DeepSeek are making waves. It's a revolutionary technology with the potential to revolutionize various industries. It uses advanced algorithms to mimic human creativity and generate new content from existing data.

articles.title: Evan Ferguson set to link up with Graham Potter again as West Ham loan deal agreed
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Evan Ferguson is joining West Ham United on loan for the rest of the season. He will play under Graham Potter at the Hammers. The deal comes at a pivotal moment for Ferguson's career as he has struggled to find consistent playing time this season.

articles.title: What is TensorFlow?
articles.author: Mayank Sharma
articles.summary: TensorFlow is an open-source collection of tools and libraries that helps developers build and train deep learning models. It was developed by Google Brain Team in November 2015 and received a major update in 2019 in the form of TensorFlow 2.0. It has many applications in different industries, including image recognition, natural language processing, and reinforcement learning.

articles.title: AI tools have put child sexual abuse ‘on steroids', Home Secretary warns
articles.author: PA Political Staff
articles.summary: Home Secretary Yvette Cooper wants to ban AI-generated child sexual abuse material and ban some paedophile manuals as part of the Crime and Policing Bill. The Bill also proposes a new offence for paedophiles who run websites to share child sex abuse which could carry a 10-year prison sentence.

articles.title: Lower-Cost AI Tools Like DeepSeek's Could Be Good for Workers
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is becoming more accessible and affordable thanks to plummeting costs. Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff recently said his company might not hire any new software engineers in 2025. John Bates, CEO of SER Group, believes AI is becoming a commodity faster than anyone anticipated.

articles.title: Trump is right to invest in AI development. But is it too late to beat China?
articles.author: Dace Potas
articles.summary: DePaul Potas is an opinion columnist for USA TODAY. He believes the next innovation battleground between the United States and China will be artificial intelligence. Trump announced a $100 billion investment in AI infrastructure under the name Stargate, a collaboration by Oracle, OpenAI and Japanese technology giant SoftBank. Trump should continue to roll back red tape and unnecessary regulations.

articles.title: Trump is right to invest in AI development. But is it too late to beat China?
articles.author: Dace Potas
articles.summary: The United States is losing the artificial intelligence race to China. Donald Trump announced a $100 billion investment in AI infrastructure under the name Stargate. Trump should continue to roll back red tape and remove unnecessary regulations that stifle innovation in AI, writes DePaul University graduate Dace Potas.

articles.title: Martin: We need some intelligence, artificial or otherwise
articles.author: Scott Martin
articles.summary: NASDAQ lost $1 billion from its market cap on Monday. AI companies got smashed by newcomers like DeepSeek and ChatGPT. Aspen, Colorado's economy has been affected by AI. The pace of construction at several major projects has stopped or can be described as funereal.

articles.title: Union Budget: 3 CoEs to help India position itself as a global powerhouse in AI
articles.author: The Siasat Daily
articles.summary: Centres of Excellence (COE) for Artificial Intelligence in education introduced in India. Industry leaders say it is heartening to see the introduction of COE for AI in education. They say India needs to prioritise investment in STEM talent and digital infrastructure to cultivate a thriving startup ecosystem.

articles.title: I'm an AI startup founder. Here are the 3 reasons my company is planning to switch to DeepSeek.
articles.summary: Steve Hsu is cofounder of AI startup SuperFocus and professor of theoretical physics and computational mathematics, science, and engineering at Michigan State University. SuperFocus will switch to open-source models like DeepSeek to save money and speed up their AI systems.

articles.title: Why Is This C.E.O. Bragging About Replacing Humans With A.I.?
articles.summary: Sebastian Siemiatkowski is the CEO of Klarna, a Swedish tech firm that helps consumers defer payment on purchases. He believes that A.I. can already do all of the jobs that humans do. His company has reduced its overall head count to under 4,000 from 5,000 as of September 2023.

articles.title: Why Is This C.E.O. Bragging About Replacing Humans With A.I.?
articles.author: Noam Scheiber
articles.summary: According to Sebastian Siemiatkowski, the chief executive of Klarna, a Swedish tech firm that helps consumers defer payment on purchases, A.I. has saved the equivalent of $10 million annually for marketing. Klarna's chatbot does the work of 700 customer service agents and it resolves cases 9 minutes faster than humans.

articles.title: DeepSeek has ripped away AI's veil of mystique. That's the real reason the tech bros fear it
articles.author: Kenan Malik
articles.summary: DeepSeek R1, a chatbot created by Chinese hedge fund, launched last month caused a lot of fuss in the tech world. According to NewsGuard, the chatbot made false claims 30% of the time and gave no answers to 53% of questions, compared with 40% and 22% respectively for the 10 leading chatbots in NewsGuard's most recent audit. It is a chat bot as capable and as flawed as other current leading models, but built at a fraction of the cost and from inferior technology.

articles.title: Not Seeing the New Siri After Updating to iOS 18.3? Here's Why

articles.summary: The new Siri design on the iPhone has become synonymous with Apple Intelligence. Apple Intelligence will also run on Macs and iPads with M-series processors, as well as the latest iPad Mini.

articles.summary: iOS 18.3 is a significant step forward for Apple's AI initiative, Apple Intelligence. The default activation of Apple Intelligence is now enabled by default across iPhones. iPhone 16 users can also benefit from expanded functionality in the Visual Intelligence feature. Apple is taking a phased approach to integrate AI into its ecosystem, continuously refining and expanding its capabilities.

articles.title: Larry Ellison, AI and a future right out of ‘1984'
articles.summary: AI is all over the news. Whoever controls AI controls geopolitics and economics. Larry Ellison is a big player in the AI world. He never finished college. He left to start building databases for the CIA. After that, he co-founded Oracle and is now the fourth richest person in the world. In a recent Oracle investor meeting, Larry laid out his vision for AI-powered surveillance.

(NASDAQ:KSCP) designs and deploys autonomous security robots for different industries and offers real-time monitoring and data services through its security operations centers. articles.title: DeepSeek Is a Win for China in the A.I. Race. Will the Party Stifle It?
articles.author: David Pierson
articles.summary: In 2017, China watched in awe as AlphaGo, an artificial intelligence program backed by Google, defeated a Chinese prodigy at a complex board game, Go. That year, Chinese officials laid out a bold plan to lead the world in A.I. by 2030, pledging billions to companies and researchers focused on the technology. From this fervor emerged DeepSeek, a start-up that created a powerful A.i. model with far less money than experts had thought possible. It is private and has no apparent state backing, but its success embodies the ambitions of China's top leader, Xi Jinping, who has exhorted his country to 'occupy the commanding heights' of technology
